## Discussion {.html-hidden .unlisted .discussion-slide background-color=black}

:::{.large}
What to you **expect** from this course?
:::

# General remarks

In this course you will **develop a technological artifact** that has the potential **to create value** for a specific organisation (e.g. prototyping a new product, improving a process, supporting a decision). 

. . .

As to that, you

:::{.incremental}
- will apply your learning from your undergraduate degree as well as from the first semester of your Masters program; and you
- will also be introduced to current methodological and theoretical knowledge. This will help you to carry out the real-world problem and to reflect on the process and the results. 
:::

. . .

It is very important that you prepare yourself for the classes (see @tbl-schedule for details).

# Contents

To support understanding and transfer of topics, additional knowledge of core concepts and related methods will be tought, e.g.:

:::{.incremental}
- Business value sources and characteristics
- Essential aspects of IT/digital resources
- Identification of (customer) needs (e.g. Design Thinking)
- The generation and development of ideas
- Challenges in implementing digital innovations (changing, adopting & using)
- Capture and measurement of value from IT/digital innovations
:::

# Learning objectives

During this course, you should advance your skills in the following areas:

::: {.incremental}
- Understand __the mechanisms by which IT creates business value__
- __How to conceptualise, design and implement IT solutions__ that create value in a specific context.
- How to __apply and contextualise existing knowledge and understanding__ of disruptive technologies in the context of a specific organisational environment
- __Problem-solving skills__ to analyze the particularities and complexities of different project contexts
- __Reflecting on social and ethical responsibilities__ and making responsible decisions with incomplete or limited information 
:::

# Effort

You will gain 5 ECTS for this course. This equals approx. __150 hours workload__, of which you need most to pass the course.

::: {.incremental}
-	Live sessions (approx. 20 hours)
- Preparation of the live sessions (approx. 10 hours)
- Project work and documentation (remaining time)
:::

::: {.fragment}
Please prepare your schedule accordingly.
:::

# Grading

During the semester you will be required to work **within a group** on a **business challenge** posed by company partners.

. . .

You present your approach to the challenge and to create value by means of IT in a **presentation**.

. . .

You detail your approach and solution in a **seminar paper**.

. . .

Details regarding the assignment can be found [here](../assignment/).

. . .

:::{.smaller}
The grade is the weighted average of the group score (60%) and the individual contributions (40%); the individual contributions must be indicated.
:::
